intro: Polygonum pseudobiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly wavy margin. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. This plant thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
